message: Happy New Year!

One of the most important parts of my job is helping constituents in Ohio‚Äôs 12th District.   Here‚Äôs a recap from the 114th Congress of how my office and I helped people like you navigate the federal government by answering their questions, advocating for their priorities and cutting through red tape.    https://goo.gl/Ayyiit

As we begin the new Congress, I would like to first thank the people of Ohio‚Äôs 12th District for this opportunity to serve them. We have a lot of work to do and busy days ahead to advance our priorities to repeal and replace Obamacare, fix our broken tax code and empower our communities to grow and thrive. As the Chairman of the Joint Economic Committee and Chairman of the Ways and Means Subcommittee on Health, I‚Äôm focused on ideas and solutions to promote opportunity, drive robust economic growth and put patients, not the government, at the center of our health care system. I look forward to working with President-elect Donald Trump‚Äôs administration to deliver results that people can count on. Let‚Äôs get to work.
In the GOP conference meeting last night, I opposed the measure to change the Office of Congressional Ethics. My full statement: http://tiberi.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=395091

Vice President-elect Mike Pence joined us on Capitol Hill this morning to talk about a better way than Obamacare. Learn more about the House Republican plan for reform and our priorities to deliver patient-centered care to you and your family. https://waysandmeans.house.gov/healthcarereform/
Yesterday was the first day of the 115th Congress. Thank you #OH12 for this opportunity to serve. It is always a humbling experience to sign the Oath of Office. #Ohio #OpeningDay

I stand with Israel. Already in the 115th Congress I have cosponsored several pieces of legislation and signed a letter to reaffirm my support for our closest ally in the Middle East. Last night, I voted to oppose the outrageous U.N. Security Council Resolution and called for its repeal.  http://freebeacon.com/politics/house-votes-condemn-u-n-resolution-israeli-settlements/

Today we honor our heroes in blue. In observance of National Law Enforcement Appreciation Day, I‚Äôm shining a blue light in the window of my office. To all our law enforcement in Ohio, thank you.  https://www.instagram.com/p/BPDz5gFh-WQ/?taken-by=pattiberi

In case you missed it, the United States International Trade Commission (USITC) unanimously ruled yesterday to protect Whirlpool jobs. This decision came after I submitted testimony on behalf of Ohio Whirlpool workers in December urging the USITC to stop foreign competitors from illegally importing large residential washers produced in China into the United States for less than they cost to make.   Learn more about this great news for our state. http://tiberi.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=395093   Rest assured, I will continue to fight to ensure our trade laws are strictly enforced to protect and create new opportunities for Ohio workers.
Americans from all walks of life need relief from the broken promises of Obamacare.   Read their stories: https://waysandmeans.house.gov/words-obamacare-hurts-americans-walks-life/

Our plan is to replace Obamacare with patient-centered reforms that are better for all Americans. These are the specific ideas that we will implement with a step-by-step approach to transition to a plan that:  1. Gives more flexibility to states. 2. Removes some of the burdensome rules and requirements on plans, providers and employers that drive up costs without improving care. 3. Makes healthcare portable and affordable. 4. Puts patients in charge instead of Washington bureaucrats. 5. Inserts more accountability into the system‚Äîfor the government, individuals, and providers.  https://waysandmeans.house.gov/healthcarereform/

Today we honor and remember Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. As we reflect on his legacy, may his words continue to challenge and inspire us to come together in service to one another.  https://www.nps.gov/mlkm/learn/quotations.htm
Inauguration Day is 3 days away. Catch the latest updates by following @TrumpInaugural on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
Sending love and prayers to President George H.W. Bush and Barbara Bush today.  http://www.dispatch.com/zz/elections/20170119/former-president-george-hw-bush-and-wife-remain-hospitalized
Tomorrow is #InaugurationDay! Thank you to everyone from #OH12 who stopped by my office in DC today for our open house. Enjoy the Trump Inaugural! #OH12inDC
Happy #InaugurationDay Ì†ºÌ∑∫Ì†ºÌ∑∏

Today is a great day for our country as we celebrate the uniquely American transition of power to our new administration. Congratulations President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence.   http://tiberi.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=395096#sthash.E1joeDnG.dpuf

We must ensure our laws respect the dignity of life. I‚Äôm proud to support the No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion Act.  http://nation.foxnews.com/2017/01/23/congress-consider-permanently-banning-taxpayer-funding-abortion-week
The people's House just took a vital step to protect unborn children and the conscience rights of Americans everywhere. #prolife https://goo.gl/ZTKCkm

We are going to replace Obamacare by taking a step-by-step approach that will give you more healthcare choices, more certainty and better access to your doctors.   Listen to my interview with WMAN - News Radio 1400 - AM and read a myth vs. fact guide on Obamacare here: http://www.jec.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/republicans/analysis?ID=612DA51A-483A-49A0-8F24-CC138D15BB57
To all the members of the pro-life generation, thank you for your work to protect the right to life. #WhyWeMarch #ProLife

Right now, there is no federal punishment for abortion providers who dispose of fetal remains in landfills. This is unconscionable and horrifying. That is why I introduced the Protecting the Dignity of Unborn Children Act to make it a federal crime for abortion providers like Planned Parenthood to dispose of unborn children in inhumane ways.   Read the bill: http://tiberi.house.gov/UploadedFiles/TIBERI_002_xml.pdf

I support President Donald Trump‚Äôs nomination of Judge Neil Gorsuch to serve on the Supreme Court of the United States. He is incredibly qualified with a long record of defending our Constitution, protecting religious liberties and preserving our system of checks and balances. I expect the Senate to confirm his nomination.

On the House floor this week ‚Üí We are moving to roll back harmful regulations so we can foster a better environment to create jobs and grow the economy.   https://www.majorityleader.gov/2017/01/31/house-targets-five-job-killing-destructive-regulations/
In case you missed the Joint Economic Committee‚Äôs weekly update:  http://www.jec.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/republicans/analysis?ID=0AE4B15B-23E6-4534-AD9A-3B381E4BF246

Medicare Advantage and Medicare Part D are extremely popular programs that provide affordable choices for seniors. Recently, the Trump administration froze harmful policies written by the Obama administration that would have limited millions of seniors‚Äô access to the care they need, prefer and rely on.   This is good news for the 50,000 Medicare Advantage participants who live in Ohio‚Äôs 12th District.  https://waysandmeans.house.gov/brady-tiberi-encouraged-cms-proposal-strengthen-medicare-advantage-part-d-programs/

Yesterday Senator Tim Scott, Senator Cory Booker and Congressman Ron Kind and I introduced the Investing in Opportunity Act. We come from different parties and different regions of the country but agree on one very important thing‚Äî success in your life shouldn't be determined by where you're born and where you live. Our bill takes an innovative approach to fight poverty by giving states the flexibility to knock down barriers for investment where it is needed most.

Today I had a number of meetings in my district office with constituents from #OH12 to listen to their concerns and to discuss Congress's priorities for health care reform‚Äîlike protecting people with pre-existing conditions and giving patients the freedom and flexibility to pick a plan that fits their needs. Looking forward to hearing from more folks this week.

This morning in Mansfield, Ohio, I joined Rusty Cates on the WMAN - News Radio 1400 - AM's morning show to update listeners on my work on their behalf in Congress. I also toured the Jones Potato Chips factory to learn more about how regulations impact their business.

Unlike Obamacare, you deserve a 21st Century health care system that puts your needs first‚Äîwith more choices, lower costs and better access to the tools that put you in charge of your own care.   Our plan for reform includes expanding access to health savings accounts, providing a refundable tax credit to purchase insurance that works for you, and protecting people with pre-existing conditions.   http://tiberi.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=395105
Congratulations to my friend Rep. Steve Stivers. Thank you for your service.  https://www.armytimes.com/articles/ohio-congressman-becomes-brigadier-general-in-national-guard

In January, I became the new chairman of the Joint Economic Committee, charged with providing Congress with economic analysis and advice. In the coming months, I will work to show how we can unshackle America's true growth potential.

I‚Äôm teaming up with Senator Rob Portman and a bipartisan group of members in the House and Senate to stop dangerous synthetic drugs from being shipped through our borders from countries like China. Learn more about our bill on Tiberi.House.gov/STOPact.
My statement regarding the President‚Äôs tax returns: http://tiberi.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=395114

Every year, I have the distinct honor of nominating young men and women to our U.S. Service Academies. These students represent the best and brightest young adults in our community.   http://tiberi.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=395110#sthash.bteID26F.dpuf
I'll be on NBC 4's the Spectrum at 10am. Tune in.

We are taking a deliberate, step-by-step approach to deliver the quality, affordable health care reforms that Americans were promised years ago. I've heard from many Ohioans from across the 12th district in my constituent meetings who have expressed their support for protecting people with pre-existing conditions. I'm listening to their concerns, and I agree. This provision was included in the health care priorities that Republicans unveiled last summer in our Better Way agenda. In addition, H.R. 1121, the Pre-Existing Conditions Protection Act, also has my full support.  http://tiberi.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=395116

Just wrapped up another day of back-to-back meetings in my Ohio office to discuss health care reform. Looking forward to more.

I was the first person to graduate from high school and earn a college degree in my family. I know firsthand the value of a good education and the opportunities it creates. It was an honor to visit with students and teachers in central Ohio today. Thank you Summit Road Elementary in Reynoldsburg, Olentangy Liberty High School in Powell, and Olentangy Meadows Elementary in Lewis Center. #OH12 #Ohio

I‚Äôm working on bringing Republicans and Democrats together with a new approach to fight poverty. The Investing in Opportunity is a ‚Äúrare display of bipartisan unity‚Äù to encourage long term investment in communities that need it most.   http://www.opportunitylives.com/bi-partisan-bill-unveiled-to-fight-poverty/

Today, I joined the National Association of Manufacturers State of Manufacturing Tour at the Anheuser-Busch Brewery in Columbus for a business roundtable with Rep. Joyce Beatty, Speaker of the Ohio House Cliff Rosenberger and Speaker Pro Tempore of the Ohio House Kirk Schuring.   We spoke about solutions that are needed to protect Ohio jobs and grow our economy, like tax and regulatory reform.
Watch President Donald J. Trump's first address to a joint session of Congress on http://jointaddress.gop.gov/.

As Republicans, we have long believed that people, not the federal bureaucracy, should be put first. I am encouraged by President Donald Trump‚Äôs commitment to putting patients at the center of our health care system, to reforming the tax code so that families can save more of their hard-earned dollars, and to reining in federal regulations to return power to our local communities. These solutions reflect the ideas that we ran on to provide relief from Obamacare‚Äôs broken promises and unleash economic growth nationwide.   Our agenda is bold because Americans demanded change and a better way. The House has already made progress by passing over a dozen jobs bills to stop harmful regulations, and the wheels are in motion to repeal Obamacare and replace it with a  plan that gives people more affordable choices and increased access to the care they need. As the health subcommittee chairman, I hope Democrats join us in this effort because as the President said, Obamacare is collapsing. We must move forward with reforms that protect our constituents from a failing system.  President Trump‚Äôs speech tonight was inspirational and it struck the right tone. America‚Äôs future is bright, and we want to empower people who make it so. That is an optimistic vision everyone can come together on.   http://tiberi.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=395117
Happy Birthday, Ohio! Ì†ºÌæà

Across Ohio, we have seen a rapid increase in deaths linked to dangerous synthetic opioids that are 50 times more potent than heroin. Learn about my solution called the Synthetics Trafficking and Overdose Prevention Act which aims to stop these drugs from crossing the border and entering our communities: Tiberi.House.Gov/STOPact

The American Health Care Act is our plan to repeal Obamacare and replace it with a 21st century system that gives people better access to quality and affordable health care. It contains specific reforms to provide relief from Obamacare‚Äôs taxes and mandates, and gives patients tools that put them in charge of their own care, like increased access to health savings accounts and tax credits to help individuals and families purchase the care they need.  Our legislation contains the ideas and priorities we outlined 8 months ago. We are moving forward with our deliberate and transparent approach to bring real health care solutions to the American people. Our next step is the markup on Wednesday in the Ways and Means Committee. I invite everyone to read our plan on ReadtheBill.GOP.  https://housegop.leadpages.co/healthcare/

Tomorrow, the Ways and Means Committee will consider the American Health Care Act. I met with President Donald J. Trump today at the White House to discuss why this is an important step to provide the patient-centered reforms that families need.   Learn more: https://waysandmeans.house.gov/american-health-care-act/

It is always great to chat with folks from #OH12 who are visiting the U.S. Capitol for tours. Before wrapping up my week in Washington today, I met these two students from Westerville who attend Ohio University.

For years we warned President Obama that his executive actions hurt Ohio‚Äôs coal industry, raised prices and limited our nation‚Äôs energy potential. President Donald J. Trump's announcement today to reverse the harmful power-plant rules will go a long way to lift the economic hardships the Obama administration forced on Ohio families, job creators and coal workers. As we work to rein in the EPA, it is my hope that this agency can take a more balanced and commonsense approach to protect the environment without putting unnecessary burdens on the backs of hardworking, middle-class Americans.

Top photos of the week ‚Üí In Congress, we are working on big solutions like rewriting our tax code and reining in federal regulations so we can foster a better environment to grow our economy, boost wages and create good paying jobs. I‚Äôm meeting with constituents and groups from across Ohio‚Äôs 12th District to listen to their concerns, update them on these important issues and inform them of my work on their behalf.

I spoke with Rusty Cates this morning on WMAN - News Radio 1400 - AM in Richland County. I‚Äôm in Mansfield today to meet with local business owners to talk about what they need to grow the economy and create jobs. Listen to the clip for an update on progress we‚Äôve made to help them do just that.
Happy Easter! Today we pray for peace as we find hope in the light of Christ.
Today is #taxday. Visit JEC.Senate.gov to read 10 reasons why we must reform our tax code.
I‚Äôm in Columbus today talking about tax reform, health care, and other issues important to Ohioans. Rep. Steve Stivers, Rep. Joyce Beatty and I just wrapped up speaking with the Columbus Realtors.
Attention local high school students: April 28 is the last day to submit your art for the Congressional Art Competition. Learn more: http://tiberi.house.gov/constituentservices/artcontest.htm

On Thursday, I joined a packed house with the Columbus Metropolitan Club to talk about President Trump‚Äôs first 100 days in office. It was a bipartisan event with Rep. Joyce Beatty.   I answered questions on progress Republicans have made reining in the federal government, our plans to reform our tax code, our efforts to provide relief from Obamacare, and much more.  For more information on these important issues, visit Tiberi.House.Gov/Issues

I was in Muskingum County yesterday talking about the STOP Act, my bill that will stop extremely potent and dangerous drugs from crossing the border through the mail.   https://www.whiznews.com/2017/04/congressman-pat-tiberi-stops-muskingum-county/

Good news: Beginning May 1, 2017, the Columbus VA Urgent Care Center (UCC) will be open 7 days a week for veterans. The UCC will be open weekdays from 7:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and weekends and holidays from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., with no appointment necessary. For more information, you can call the Columbus VA at 614-257-5200.

Congressman Jim Renacci and I called Ohioans yesterday evening to update them on our work on the Ways and Means Committee. Our committee is in charge of rewriting our tax code to grow our economy, increase wages and transform the IRS into an agency that better serves Americans. Thanks to all who joined our call.     Have a question on where I stand on other issues we discussed like repealing Obamacare, reining in the federal government and fighting gridlock in Washington? ‚Üí Visit Tiberi.House.Gov/Issues.

Tomorrow is Drug Take Back Day. You can help fight the opioid epidemic by dropping off unused prescription drugs at a convenient location near you. Learn more: https://www.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/drug_disposal/takeback/

This week is National Small Business Week and we are recognizing the 29 million small businesses in the USA. Republicans in Congress are working on vital reforms to help them take risks, create jobs and boost wages for hardworking Americans.   What do you think should be our top priority to encourage economic growth and help our small businesses succeed?  Complete this survey to share your thoughts: https://tiberi.house.gov/forms/form/?ID=3129

Here are 12 things to know about the funding bill Congress is considering today:   1. It provides for the largest military pay raise in 6 years & helps rebuild our military.  2. It provides $12.2 billion to strengthen the border.  3. It provides additional funding for the fight against ISIS and for our allies to combat Russian aggression.  4. It eliminates or consolidates more than 150 government programs & initiatives.  5. It freezes the IRS at current funding levels.  6. It does not provide any funding for President Obama‚Äôs climate slush fund.  7. It reins in the EPA while fully funding the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative.  8. It provides no new funding for Obamacare and prohibits a taxpayer bailout of Obamacare‚Äôs risk corridors.  9. It protects life and prohibits federal funding of abortions.  10. It extends health care benefits for retired coal miners.  11. It provides additional resources to prevent & treat the opioid epidemic.  12. President Trump supports it.

The American Health Care Act will cover people with pre-existing conditions.   Here‚Äôs how: https://www.majorityleader.gov/2017/05/03/dont-believe-fear-mongering-plan-pre-existing-conditions-covered/

Obamacare is failing and it is leaving people with higher costs, fewer choices and unreliable care.   With the American Health Care Act, we are providing relief from these pervasive problems that are hurting Americans from all walks of life. https://goo.gl/dlB3de

There is a lot of misinformation being circulated about health care coverage for Members of Congress.   Here are the facts‚Üí Congress should live by the rules and laws they write. Period. That is why I currently have an Obamacare plan. Yesterday, the House passed H.R. 2192 which ensures no member will be exempt from the American Health Care Act. I am a cosponsor of this bill and I voted for it.

Powerful piece by Congresswoman Cathy McMorris Rodgers:  "To me, protecting people with preexisting conditions isn‚Äôt just good policy ‚Äî it‚Äôs a personal mission.  "All across the country, families like mine have real concerns about the future of health care, and they are why we‚Äôre focusing on results and working on these reforms. Obamacare is wrong for America. It has failed, and it‚Äôs only getting worse ‚Äî making health care more expensive and less accessible. To stand by and do nothing would be irresponsible. The AHCA is a monumental step forward that trusts the American people ‚Äî not the federal government ‚Äî to make the best decisions for themselves and their families."  https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/my-son-has-a-preexisting-condition-hes-one-of-the-reasons-i-voted-for-the-ahca/2017/05/04/26c234b2-30fd-11e7-9534-00e4656c22aa_story.html?utm_term=.01fb18381ddb
In case you missed this week's economic update from the Joint Economic Committee, Republicans.

My statement regarding FBI Director James Comey: There are many questions about Director Comey‚Äôs firing that the White House needs to answer. That said, I continue to support the ongoing bipartisan investigations into Russia in both the House and Senate intelligence committees to examine the facts and follow the evidence where it leads. If the leaders of these committees together determine that a special prosecutor is warranted, I would support that decision.

This is a tragic and heartbreaking day in Kirkersville. Denice and I are praying for the victims, our fallen officer Chief Steven Disario, his family and for law enforcement officers everywhere.  In the wake of such senseless and horrifying violence, may we find hope in the strength of our neighbors and continue to hold the entire community of Kirkersville closely to our hearts.

This weekend was a very special one for my family. Yesterday, the triplets had their First Holy Communion and today, we are celebrating Mother's Day with Denice and my mom.   #HappyMothersDay to the beautiful women in my life who are such strong examples of faith and love to my girls.

From our nation‚Äôs porous borders to our emergency rooms and doctors‚Äô offices, the opioid epidemic is among the most complex and multifaceted crises of our time.   We must combat it with preventative efforts that equally and aggressively focus on the supply and demand side of illegal drugs by keeping them out of our communities and reducing the number of addictive opioids that are being prescribed.  http://www.dispatch.com/opinion/20170512/pat-tiberi-opioid-epidemic-calls-for-preventative-efforts

In the last Congress, Senator Rob Portman and I introduced legislation to rename the Newark VA facility in honor of Specialist Daniel L. Kinnard, who was a medic in the U.S. Army during the Vietnam War and was killed in action rendering aid to his fellow soldiers on March 9, 1968.   I was in Newark yesterday for the dedication ceremony and the VA Clinic officially became the Daniel L. Kinnard VA Community Based Outpatient Clinic. It was humbling to join Daniel‚Äôs family at the ceremony to honor his memory. To the Kinnards and all our local veterans and their families, thank you.

There is growing evidence that Obamacare‚Äôs fundamental problems are driving up costs and forcing insurers out of the marketplace. Premiums across the country have more than doubled on the exchanges since 2013.   ‚¨áÔ∏è  "Obamacare's insurance regulations contributed to premiums doubling over the course of four years, finds a new federal report.  The findings, assembled by the Health and Human Services Office of the Assistant Secretary for Planning and Evaluation, show that since 2013, one year before the Obamacare regulations were fully implemented, premiums have risen from an average of $2,784 in 2013 to $5,712 in 2017 on the federal exchange, healthcare.gov. This represents an increase of $2,928, or 105 percent."  http://www.washingtonexaminer.com/premiums-have-doubled-since-before-obamacare-says-hhs-report/article/2623993

This is just more evidence that conditions under Obamacare are just going to get worse. It is collapsing under its own weight. For years, Ohioans have faced higher premiums and fewer choices because of this fundamentally broken law. Now 20 counties in Ohio, including Muskingum County in my district, will have zero options on the exchange.   The House started the process in the American Health Care Act to repeal Obamacare and replace it with needed solutions to restore the free market, lower costs and increase choices. It is now the Senate‚Äôs turn to deliver on our promise to move health care reform forward so that Ohioans and all Americans have reliable access to the care they need.  http://freebeacon.com/issues/20-ohio-counties-slated-no-obamacare-insurance-coverage-next-year/

The New Markets Tax Credit is a proven and tested program that encourages public-private partnerships to invest in rural and urban areas that need it the most. In this op-ed, Congressman Richard E. Neal (D-Mass.) and I explain why it should become a permanent part of our tax code so we can fight poverty, unlock economic opportunities and create more jobs in our own districts and across the country.  http://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/economy-budget/337429-for-a-proven-and-tested-program-its-time-to-make-a-good
Praying for my friend Steve Scalise, congressional staff, and the officers shot and injured. Thankful for the work of Capitol Police this morning.

Is your passport about to expire? You aren't alone. In fact, the U.S. Passport Service is expecting a surge.  Approximately 48 million passports will expire between FY 2017 and FY 2019, compared to 31 million in the past three years. Passport Services anticipates at least 21.1 million passport applications in FY 2017, and 20.6 million in FY 2018. That means longer processing times of more than 6-8 weeks.  What should you do? If your passport is set to expire this year, it is strongly encouraged that you start the process now to renew it.   To learn more visit  https://tiberi.house.gov/constituentservices/casework/passports.htm and call (614) 523 2555 to ask for help from my office.

What is the latest on health care in America? The current health care system is broken and it is hurting American families. Premiums have skyrocketed and people have limited or no choices on the Obamacare exchanges. Next year, 47 counties will have zero coverage options‚Äîthat includes 18 counties in Ohio.   Medicaid is also on an unsustainable fiscal path. If we don‚Äôt act, federal and state Medicaid spending will top $1 trillion in 2027. That isn‚Äôt just a budget issue, it is a moral one that threatens care for the most vulnerable citizens across the country.  What can we do to fix it? Reforms in the American Health Care Act (AHCA) will provide the choices you want, the affordability you need and the quality care you deserve. Watch this new video to learn more about how AHCA will protect Americans with pre-existing conditions, lower premiums, and reform Medicaid.
We are talking about how we can close the skills gap and help more Americans find good paying jobs. Tune in!

Medicaid is currently on an unsustainable fiscal path. It is one of the fastest growing mandatory spending programs and accounts for more than half of means-tested spending. On its current track, in ten years, Medicaid will cost $1 trillion every single year. If we don‚Äôt act, it jeopardizes care for the most vulnerable in our society.   From George Will: ‚ÄúMedicaid‚Äôs unrestrained growth will become economically impossible, then arithmetically impossible.‚Äù

It has been 31 years since the last major overhaul of America‚Äôs tax code. So every day in August, the Committee on Ways and Means is highlighting 31 reasons why American families and job creators need bold, pro-growth tax reform.  Here we go with reason #1 ‚û°Ô∏è Our broken tax code is a drag on our economy.

Yesterday Representatives Steve Stivers, Joyce Beatty and I participated in a bipartisan defense roundtable in Columbus. We spoke about our efforts to enhance Ohio's role in America's defense industry and our work to support the missions of our hometown units, like the 179th Airlift Wing in Mansfield. #OH12

It is day #2 for 31 reasons for tax reform.  ‚û°Ô∏èRight now, Americans spend too much money filing their taxes.‚¨ÖÔ∏è  A simpler code that lowers rates for all income levels and eliminates the maze of special interest tax breaks will mean a simpler way to file‚Äîlike on a postcard.  https://tiberi.house.gov/forms/form/?ID=3131

On Wednesday, I updated the Genoa Township Business Association on the House‚Äôs progress on solutions to grow our economy and foster a better environment to create jobs. Notably, we‚Äôve advanced over a dozen jobs bills that cut Obama-era regulations that were holding back Ohio small businesses, employers, farmers and workers. Overall, these regulatory reforms will save Americans $3.7 billion in regulatory costs and 4.2 million hours in filing paperwork.   https://tiberi.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=395230

Day #3 for 31 reasons for tax reform‚û°Ô∏è Americans at every income level deserve to keep more of their paychecks. That is why we are proposing to reduce taxes for all Americans at all income levels.

Day #5 for 31 reasons for tax reform ‚Üí America‚Äôs tax code is now more than 2.4 million words long. Day #11 for 31 reasons for tax reform ‚Üí Taxpayers are spending more than 8.9 billion hours each year complying with the IRS tax filing requirements.

President Obama‚Äôs unconstitutional DACA program was one of the most egregious examples of his executive overreach. The Trump administration‚Äôs decision to phase out DACA is good news for the rule of law.   As the son of immigrants who legally came to the United States from Italy, I have seen the success story of legal immigration firsthand. In order to ensure this country remains a beacon of hope we must adhere to the Constitution, which empowers Congress to write immigration laws, not the executive branch. Congress has six months to act. This is an opportunity for us to identify needed solutions that are fair and orderly for Dreamers who didn‚Äôt choose to break our laws and know no other home than America.

Today we released a framework for tax reform that will help all Americans, especially those who have felt left behind in the slow and uneven economic recovery of the past decade. We will simplify the code, make it easier for everyone to file their taxes, and allow middle-income Americans to keep more of their paychecks so they have the confidence and ability to save, plan for the future and get ahead.   We have more work to do to transition this framework into legislation. During that process, it is one of my top priorities to ensure that tax reform includes tools that unleash economic growth and job creation in communities that need it the most. This is an historic opportunity to overhaul our code and identify solutions that work to fight poverty and ensure more people‚Äîno matter their background or zip code‚Äîare empowered to succeed. As a member of the Ways and Means Committee, I‚Äôm honored to be a voice in this process and I look forward to advocating for essential reforms that will support a stronger Ohio and nation.  Read the framework: https://tiberi.house.gov/uploadedfiles/tax_framework_.pdf

My parents, Italian immigrants who worked as a steelworker and a seamstress, sat me down when I got my first job at McDonald‚Äôs to talk about my paycheck. America needs an energy strategy that supports our economy, creates jobs and bolsters our independence. The Clean Power Plan, another example of President Obama‚Äôs executive overreach, clearly missed the mark. I‚Äôve long advocated for its repeal and I applaud the Trump administration‚Äôs decision to do so.   The EPA and Congress should take a more commonsense approach to protect the environment without putting unnecessary burdens, like higher energy costs, on the backs of hardworking, middle-class families.

I did not support President Obama‚Äôs flawed and dangerous Iran deal, and I applaud President Donald J. Trump's announcement to not certify it. The Iranian regime has consistently remained hostile to Israel, violated multiple UN resolutions to build their ballistic missile program, and has posed a wide range of threats to the region and our own national security. Following Trump‚Äôs decision, Congress will now work with the administration to develop a stronger strategy with stricter enforcement to keep Iran from obtaining nuclear weapons.

It has been the most remarkable honor of my life to serve the people of the 12th District. As the son of Italian immigrants, I am forever grateful for the opportunity my parents gave me by coming to America and raising our family in Ohio. It was because of their pursuit of the American Dream that made it possible for me to serve 17 years in the halls of Congress representing my home. This truly is the greatest country in the world.  Today, it is with a humble and thankful heart that I announce I will not be seeking reelection. While I have not yet determined a final resignation date, I will be leaving Congress by January 31, 2018. I have been presented with an opportunity to lead the Ohio Business Roundtable that will allow me to continue to work on public policy issues impacting Ohioans while also spending more time with my family. Leaving Congress is not a decision I take lightly but after a lot of consideration, it is the best one for me, my wife, Denice, and our four wonderful daughters.  Over the years, I‚Äôve met and worked with so many amazing people, including constituents from all walks of life and my colleagues from across the country. I‚Äôve also had the best staff behind me throughout my entire career. We have helped thousands of constituents with problems they have had with the federal government and fought for solutions to improve the lives of Americans everywhere. I am proud of my team‚Äôs work and everything that we have accomplished together.  In Congress, nothing is possible without the support of the people we represent. To the people of Ohio‚Äôs 12th District, I will always be appreciative of the years you‚Äôve allowed me to serve. Thank you.

For years, we have made the case for why Americans need a fairer tax code that contributes to a more vibrant economy, creates jobs and boosts wages. This is our moment to deliver, and it is one that I‚Äôve advocated for on behalf of my constituents in Ohio‚Äôs 12th District since my first day in Congress.   With the passage of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act in the House, we are on the brink of a pro-growth and pro-family tax reform package becoming law. This plan will deliver tax relief and put more money in the pockets of hardworking Ohioans. How much? For the average middle-income family of four in my district, it‚Äôs a tax cut of $2,700. That is $2,700 that allows them to plan for their future, save for retirement, and invest in their kids‚Äô education.   I‚Äôve said time and time again that this is an historic effort. Today, the House did its job. Next, the Senate must do theirs. We cannot let this once-in-a-generation opportunity go to waste.
Happy Thanksgiving!
